meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Natalie Knowles Peter Hansen Erin Zwiener Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6440.

td.p: Natalie Knowles, a marketing manager from Raleigh, North Carolina
Peter Hansen, a project manager from New York, New York
Erin Zwiener, a conservation journalist and pet-sitter from Abiquiu, New Mexico (whose 1-day cash winnings total $16,200)

tr.td: THE CONSTITUTIONAL CONVENTION
SINGERS "R" US
OFFICIAL LANGUAGES
BE A PART OF SEWCIETY
NOW A FEW WORDS
(Sarah: These whales came a long way to find this exact spot, and we'll find out why.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'This oldest delegate declared that a carved sun on Washington\'s chair was "a rising and not a setting sun"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: This oldest delegate declared that a carved sun on Washington's chair was "a rising and not a setting sun"

(Alex: No.)
...

[Laughter]

husbandry

Erin!Peter
')

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 14):

tr.td: Erin!
Peter
Natalie

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Erin!
Peter
Natalie
PROLOGUES
SITCOM COUPLES
(Alex: We'll give you [*]--you have to identify the show.)
STATE BY COUNTIES
(Alex: We'll give you counties, you have to identify the state.)
B IN THE MIDDLE
(Alex: You will find a "B" in the exact middle of the correct response.)
IT'S NOT JUST A GOOD IDEA
IT'S THE MATH OR SCIENCE LAW

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
